alert.note: Alert for York (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 30 at 8:50PM EDT until further notice by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of upstate South Carolina, including the following county, York. * WHEN...Until 1100 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 848 PM EDT, Despite the threat of additional heavy rainfall diminishing through late evening, isolated excessive runoff will remain a threat for virtually the entire county, so this advisory is extended in time. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Rock Hill, York, Southwest Charlotte, Fort Mill, Tega Cay, Clover, Newport, Lesslie, Sharon, Hickory Grove, Mcconnells, Smyrna, Lake Wylie, Kings Mountain State Park, Carowinds, Catawba, Bethany, Edgemoor and Bullock Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
